repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary: This is a text book of rhetoric. It seems to be rare book as very few manuscripts are noted in New Catalogus Catalogorum and Aufrecht Catalogus. Front documentation note in Grantha Script - Alaṃkāranikaṣa Sudhīndrayogīviracita Third word is unclear. Due to severe damage to the last folio, the text has been lost. Before folio 1v some thing is scribbled in Granth script and numer 2 in Tamil written in the left margin. This folio's unclear content doesn't appear to be connected to the text Alaṃkāranikaṣa.

msItem.title: Alaṃkāranikaṣa
msItem.author: Sudhīndrayogī

filiation.p: New Catalogus Catalogorum vol 01 pp: 294 Aufrecht Catalogus vol-1:p-032.

msItem.incipit: 1v1 [gap of 1 syllable due to wormhole]yādyaḥ premakopāvaharacibhramarāt saṃbhramāntamumauleścuḍācandromuḍāni caraṇanakhadakhāpuritārdhaḥ purāreḥ yasyālokena rākā rajanikarapari [gap of 2 syllables due to broken folio.]
msItem.explicit:
80v 12 [tvā]t vi (gap of approximately 13 syllables due to broken folio.) saṃsānu tanmate smṛtiparyyavasa (gap of approximately 5 syllables due to broken folio.) dukta sādṛśyanibandhanātpraprastutapraśaṃsāviśeṣa aiva aprastutapraśaṃsā syādaprakāṇḍe tathāspatiḥ sukhañjivati [nariṇā?]
81r 1 vane (gap of almost of half of the line as folio is damaged.) nta? sulabhairjaladaṃ ? ārā
81r 2 vasādhī (gap of almost of half of the line as folio is damaged.) ṇa (gap of a syllable due to injured folio.) ca tena darśitatvāt sukhañjīvatītyeta(cca) (gap of almost of half of the line as folio is damaged.) ṇṇena manasvinītyinmati? garja? (gap of a few syllables due to broken folio.) prastutapraśaṃsanasāmānyalakṣaṇasya stutiparyā

support.p: Thin plam leaf as guard folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil Letter numerals in the left margin of the verso.
supportDesc.condition: Despite the corners of the folio being damaged, it is in good condition of preservation.

additions.desc: On 1v hariḥ oṃ is written in the left margin.

encodingDesc.p: Question mark is used to show doubtful reading. Spaces are added to separate words at some places.
